an7.32:1.1: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:
an7.32:2.1: “Sir, these seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.
an7.32:2.3: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for immersion, for diligence, and for hospitality.
an7.32:2.4: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”
an7.32:2.7: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
an7.32:3.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, adding:
an7.32:4.1: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an7.32:4.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an7.32:4.4: and keen respect for the training.
an7.32:5.4: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
